comment: Dr Barnes was amazing and I would advise anyone to take her! Assignments were straight forward and easy. Pay attention to the lectures and you're set for an easy A.
You realistically shouldn't get any grade lower than an A in this class. This professor gives you clear grading criteria and is very considerate.

If you put effort, watch the lectures and take good notes, this class is an EASY A. No tests or quizzes, but every week there is either a discussion post where you need to reference lecture and textbook for credit, assignment or both. Midterm and final are essays basically but just follow the rubric and she'll give you a 100. overall rlly good prof
She was so sweet and you can tell she has a passion for what she teaches. Just do the work and everything will fall into place.

There's either one discussion post (original post or reply) or one assignment (usually about two paragraphs) due each week. There are no quizzes or exams. She grades very leniently on the assignments and she doesn't care if you're not that great of a writer, as long as you do the assignment. Overall very kind and the lectures are well done!

Easy class, nice professor. She gives video lectures but you actually have to watch through them since there are little to no info on her slides. There were discussions each week where you would rotate from either posting or replying. There were also a few papers/other assignments. The only thing is that I wish she would give more feedback.

Her class mostly consisted of discussion posts; every other week, you would either create a post or reply to one (no required word count). You have 2 midterms that are papers and your final is the same. No quizzes or tests! My only issue is that she does video lectures (with pictures) rather than notes. But I recommend this class for an easy A!!!!!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Please take her she is such an amazing Professor. Her lectures are really great because she goes in depth and tries to make them interesting. You will have 1 discussion post weekly, no quizzes, two midterms which are open notes plus she's an easy grader, and some assignments throughout the semester which are really fun. PLEASE TAKE HER!!!

Amazing professor, my only complaint is that I am a visual learner, not an auditory learner. Because of that it was a little more difficult to intake information through her lectures because it is mainly audio with little to no written information in the slides. I still reccommend her cause the workload isnt too difficult and she is an easy grader

Easiest and most enjoyable history class I've ever taken! The assignments are not too difficult and some of them are fun, she definitley gets creative with assignments. A lot of lectures, I will say I wish she would add more info to the slides. Take her for history you wont regret it

Very good teacher with clear grading criteria. If you listen to her lectures and finish your work on time you will definitely get an A in this class as she is very understanding and does not grade super hard.

Never used the textbook. 1-4 video lectures a week-hated doing them-but they explain the content she looks for in your assignments: 2 mini-papers, 2 midterms(easy), and discussions that you either post or reply to per week. Very understanding when you put in the work. I went from failing to an A. Even ended up enjoying some of the content. Take her
Everything is open notes (including final). It is nearly impossible to fail her class. If you have to miss for an extend period she is VERY helpful on making sure you don't miss anything important.

Attend class, follow the paper/test rubric, and speak up in discussions and you'll be fine. Tests are five written paragraphs on lecture subjects, but she makes it really easy to prep for. Lectures are very interesting and discussions are good and civil even with differing opinions. Papers are really the only homework and only one page each.

This class is very lecture heavy. Attendance is not mandatory but you should at least go every Friday. Friday are discussion days and you must participate for a grade. The discussions aren't hard. Other than participation, you are just graded on one page papers. And her exams are all short essay but you can use notes on them.

Her lectures are not easy for me to understand, but she has a discussion every week, and you have to post every other week. There are easy weekly assignments every other week, and a small one-page paper every other week as well. She is an easy grader. There is a midterm and a final. Super easy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She had a mid term and a final but both of those were essays !! I managed to get A..
Shes a great professor !!
Take her online !! Theres is no test or quizzes
This is the best history professor if you like writing !! She is funny to!!
Im taking this professor again for spring 2021!!
She gives you 12 terms, you have to choose 10 and write a paragraph on each!! Its a easy A!
She was very helpful and supportive throughout the semester.
Shes literally one of the best professors that I ever had at Kennesaw State University !!
I had Whitney Barnes for 1111 and it was an easy A
This is the easiest class that I have taken !! Recommend taken her !!

Good professor. Must pay attention to lectures to pass tests. Just showing up won't cut it, you have to ask questions and act enthused to get a participation grade. Lots of papers, and they're easy aside from the fact that she's part English professor and deducts points for sentence structure, etc. (You won't make above a 95 or so on the papers.)
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof Barnes is very nice & understanding. However, her lectures are insanely boring as she talks for almost an hour each class. Over the semester you are expected to take notes as your final will be over potential IDS. You'll also write a lot of short papers & a 4-page essay. This class is easy to get an A if you turn everything in and really try.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She was not a bad professor, the lectures were just really boring and we had to write quite a bit of essays, but they were easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Barnes is a sweet and funny prof., but she moves very fast through her lectures. You have to really pay attention in class, and take as many notes as possible. A lot of short papers, which she grades strictly and 2 ID terms tests for the midterm and final. She doesn't give higher than 93 on papers. So it's important to do well on tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY
